Posts.Content: Prostate Cancer at 27 years old I am 27 years old and have been diagnosed with prostate cancer. I have no symptoms of prostate cancer. My doctor accidentally put in for a PSA level test when I was doing my yearly check up and the results came back at 4.28 on January 29, 2013. We thought it was a fluke and ordered another PSA test and the results came back at 4.45 on March 12, 2013. Waited about 7 months and had another PSA test that read 3.93 on November 1, 2013. I had a biopsy on December 18, 2013 and the results came back as prostate cancer. RIGHT LOBE OF PROSTATE [5 CORES], NEEDLE BIOSPY (A): -Prostatic adenocarcinoma. -Gleason score: 3 + 3 = Score of 6 in 3 of 5 cores. -Comprising 10%, 30%, and 50% of the involved cores. -Negative for perineural invasion. LEFT LOBE OF PROSTATE [5 CORES], NEEDLE BIOPSY (B): -Prostatic adenocarcinoma -Gleason score: 3 + 3 = Score of 6 in 4 of 5 cores. -Comprising <5%, 10%, 15%, and 80% of the involved cores. -Perineural invasion identified. T1cN0M0 2/13/2014 4.10 11/01/2013 Serum 3.93 13.2 03/12/2013 Serum 4.45 H 13.5 01/29/2013 Serum 4.28 H 13.8 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ I had a second opinion and these are the results (February 26, 2014) Right Base - Benign Right Lateral Base - Benign Right Mid - Adenocarcinoma 10% Right Lateral Mid - Adenocarcinoma 3% Right Apex - Adenocarcinoma 40% Right Lateral Apex - HG PIN Left Base - Adenocarcinoma 3% Left Lateral Base - HG PIN, BUDDING Left Mid - Benign Left Lateral Mid - Adenocarcinoma 5% Left Apex - 10% Left Lateral Apex - 10% --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The slides were sent off to another lab and the results read: Right Base - Prostatic Tissue, no tumor present. Right Lateral Base - Prostatic tissue, no tumor present. Right Mid - PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON - 6. 1.0MM FOCUS Right Lateral Mid - FEW ATYPICAL GLANDS, SUSPICIOUS FOR CARCINOMA Right Apex - PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON - 6. TWO FOCI (2.0mm, 5.0mm) Right Lateral Apex - FOCAL HIGH GRADE PROSTATIC INTRAEPITHELIAL NEOPLASIA Left Base - FEW ATYPICAL GLANDS, SUSPICIOUS FOR CARCINOMA Left Lateral Base - FEW ATYPICAL GLANDS, SUSPICIOUS FOR CARCINOMA Left Mid - Prostatic tissue, no tumor present Left Lateral Mid - FEW ATYPICAL GLANDS, SUSPICIOUS FOR CARCINOMA Left Apex - PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON - 6. 2.0mm FOCUS Left Lateral Apex - PROSTATIC ADENOCARINOMA, GLEASON - 6. 2.0mm FOCUS COMMENT: The submitted immunohistochemical statins triple cocktail (p63, HMWCK, p504s) on parts A, C, D, E, F, G, H, J and K support the above diagnoses. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The doctor wants me to bank sperm and have a surgery within the next couple weeks/months. I am not comfortable with that and I'd rather do active surveillance. I am very active and very healthy, no medical issues. Guys out there with knowledge and experience with PC, what would yall recommend? Thank You!
Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer at 27 years old

Posts.Content: Me being diagnosed with PC has everyone shocked including me. I have no kids and the thought of not being able to have kids scares me, unless I bank my sperm. I am curious if having spent 15 months in Afghanistan has anything to do with the cause of the PC? Also I have a possible job coming up that would require me to leave the country for 3 1/2 months at a time and home for 35 days and back again. What is the recovery time for PC surgery? Also is a weak bladder and leakage common? I told the Doc I wanted to wait at least a year or two and then treat it because I don't want to miss this job opportunity. But I'll see what he says when I go in for our talk on the 21st of this month.
Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer at 27 years old

Posts.Content: Thank you for your help. I have a lot of tough decisions to make quickly. Your information is helpful, I appreciate it.

Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer at 27 years old

Posts.Content: Me being diagnosed with PC has everyone shocked including me. I have no kids and the thought of not being able to have kids scares me, unless I bank my sperm. I am curious if having spent 15 months in Afghanistan has anything to do with the cause of the PC? Also I have a possible job coming up that would require me to leave the country for 3 1/2 months at a time and home for 35 days and back again. What is the recovery time for PC surgery? Also is a weak bladder and leakage common? I told the Doc I wanted to wait at least a year or two and then treat it because I don't want to miss this job opportunity. But I'll see what he says when I go in for our talk on the 21st of this month.
